us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.interfaces

Interface Line2DReadOnly

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFrameLine2DBasics, FrameLine2DBasics, FrameLine2DReadOnly, Line2DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameLine2D, Line2D

    public interface Line2DReadOnly
    Read-only interface for a line 2D.

    A line 2D represents an infinitely long line in the XY-plane and defined by a point and a direction.

      Tests on a per component basis, if this line 2D is exactly equal to other.

      default double parameterGivenPointOnLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointOnLine, double epsilon)
      Calculates the parameter 't' corresponding to the coordinates of the given pointOnLine 'p' by solving the line equation:
      p = t * n + p0
      where n is the unit-vector defining the direction of this line and p0 is the point defining this line which also corresponds to the point for which t=0.
      default Line2DBasics perpendicularLineThroughPoint(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
      Calculates and returns a line that is perpendicular to this line, with its direction pointing to the left of this line, while going through the given point.

      Modifies perpendicularLineToPack such that it is perpendicular to this line, with its direction pointing to the left of this line, while going through the given point.

      Returns the vector that is perpendicular to this line and pointing to the left.
      default void perpendicularVector(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DBasics vectorToPack)
      Packs into vectorToPack the vector that is perpendicular to this line and pointing to the left.

      Calculates the coordinates of the point 'p' given the parameter 't' as follows:
      p = t * n + p0
      where n is the unit-vector defining the direction of this line and p0 is the point defining this line which also corresponds to the point for which t=0.

      Calculates the coordinates of the point 'p' given the parameter 't' as follows:
      p = t * n + p0
      where n is the unit-vector defining the direction of this line and p0 is the point defining this line which also corresponds to the point for which t=0.

      • distance

        default double distance(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Computes the minimum distance the given 3D point and this line.

        Edge cases:

        • if direction.length() < EuclidGeometryTools.ONE_TRILLIONTH, this method returns the distance between point and the given point.

        Parameters:
        point - 2D point to compute the distance from the line. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the minimum distance between the 2D point and this 2D line.

      • intersectionWith

        default us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics[] intersectionWith(ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly convexPolygon)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between this line and the given convex polygon 2D.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method behaves as if there is no intersections and returns null.
        • If no intersections exist, this method returns null.

        Parameters:
        convexPolygon - the convex polygon this line may intersect. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the intersections between between the line and the polygon or null if the method failed or if there is no intersections.
        Throws:
        OutdatedPolygonException - if the convex polygon is not up-to-date.

      • intersectionWith

        default int intersectionWith(ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly convexPolygon,
                             us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                             us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between this line and the given convex polygon 2D.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method behaves as if there is no intersections.
        • If no intersections exist, this method returns 0 and the two intersection-to-pack arguments remain unmodified.
        • If there is only one intersection, this method returns 1 and the coordinates of the only intersection are stored in firstIntersectionToPack. secondIntersectionToPack remains unmodified.

        Parameters:
        convexPolygon - the convex polygon this line may intersect. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between this line and the polygon.
        Throws:
        OutdatedPolygonException - if the convex polygon is not up-to-date.

      • intersectionWith

        default us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics intersectionWith(Line2DReadOnly secondLine)
        Calculates the coordinates of the intersection between this line and the given line and returns the result.

        Edge cases:

        • if the two lines are parallel but not collinear, the two lines do not intersect and this method returns null.
        • if the two lines are collinear, the two lines are assumed to be intersecting at this.point.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Parameters:
        secondLine - the other line that may intersect this line. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the intersection if the two lines intersects, null otherwise.

      • intersectionWith

        default boolean intersectionWith(Line2DReadOnly secondLine,
                                 us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics intersectionToPack)
        Calculates the coordinates of the intersection between this line and the given line and stores the result in intersectionToPack.

        Edge cases:

        • if the two lines are parallel but not collinear, the two lines do not intersect and this method returns null.
        • if the two lines are collinear, the two lines are assumed to be intersecting at this.point.

        Parameters:
        secondLine - the other line that may intersect this line. Not modified.
        intersectionToPack - the 2D point in which the result is stored. Modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines intersects, false otherwise.

      • intersectionWith

        default us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics intersectionWith(LineSegment2DReadOnly lineSegment)
        Calculates the coordinates of the intersection between this line and the given line segment and returns the result.

        Edge cases:

        • When this line and the line segment are parallel but not collinear, they do not intersect.
        • When this line and the line segment are collinear, they are assumed to intersect at lineSegmentStart.
        • When this line intersects the line segment at one of its endpoints, this method returns a copy of the endpoint where the intersection is happening.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Parameters:
        lineSegment - the line segment that may intersect this line. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the intersection if the line intersects the line segment, null otherwise.

      • intersectionWith

        default boolean intersectionWith(LineSegment2DReadOnly lineSegment,
                                 us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics intersectionToPack)
        Calculates the coordinates of the intersection between this line and the given line segment and stores the result in intersectionToPack.

        Edge cases:

        • When this line and the line segment are parallel but not collinear, they do not intersect.
        • When this line and the line segment are collinear, they are assumed to intersect at lineSegmentStart.
        • When this line intersects the line segment at one of its endpoints, this method returns true and the endpoint is the intersection.

        Parameters:
        lineSegment - the line segment that may intersect this line. Not modified.
        intersectionToPack - the 2D point in which the result is stored. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        true if the line intersects the line segment, false otherwise.

      • isPointBehindLine

        default boolean isPointBehindLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Returns a boolean value, stating whether the query point is in behind of this line or not.

        The idea of 'behind' refers to the side of the line the x-axis is pointing away.

        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the point is in behind of this line, false if the point is front the line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the given point is located exactly on this line.

      • isPointInFrontOfLine

        default boolean isPointInFrontOfLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Returns a boolean value, stating whether the query point is in front of this line or not.

        The idea of 'front' refers to the side of the line toward which the x-axis is pointing.

        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the point is in front of this line, false if the point is behind the line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the given point is located exactly on this line.

      • isPointInFrontOfLine

        default boolean isPointInFrontOfLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly frontDirection,
                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Returns a boolean value, stating whether the query point is in front of this line or not.

        The idea of 'front' refers to the side of the line toward which the given vector frontDirection is pointing.

        Parameters:
        frontDirection - the vector used to define the side of the line which is to be considered as the front. Not modified.
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the point is in front of this line, false if the point is behind the line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the given point is located exactly on this line.

      • isPointOnLeftSideOfLine

        default boolean isPointOnLeftSideOfLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Returns a boolean value, stating whether a 2D point is on the left or right side of this line. The idea of "side" is determined based on the direction of the line.

        For instance, given the this.direction components x = 0, and y = 1, and the this.point coordinates x = 0, and y = 0, a point located on:

        • the left side of this line has a negative y coordinate.
        • the right side of this line has a positive y coordinate.

        This method will return false if the point is on this line.
        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query point.
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the left side of this line, false if the point is on the right side or exactly on this line.

      • isPointOnLine

        default boolean isPointOnLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Tests if the given is located on this line.

        More precisely, the point is assumed to be on this line if it is located at a distance less than 1.0e-8 from it.

        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the point is located on this line, false otherwise.

      • isPointOnLine

        default boolean isPointOnLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point,
                              double epsilon)
        Tests if the given is located on this line.

        More precisely, the point is assumed to be on this line if it is located at a distance less than epsilon from it.

        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance used for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the point is located on this line, false otherwise.

      • isPointOnRightSideOfLine

        default boolean isPointOnRightSideOfLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Returns a boolean value, stating whether a 2D point is on the left or right side of this line. The idea of "side" is determined based on the direction of the line.

        For instance, given the this.direction components x = 0, and y = 1, and the this.point coordinates x = 0, and y = 0, a point located on:

        • the left side of this line has a negative y coordinate.
        • the right side of this line has a positive y coordinate.

        This method will return false if the point is on this line.
        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query point.
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the right side of this line, false if the point is on the left side or exactly on this line.

      • isPointOnSideOfLine

        default boolean isPointOnSideOfLine(double pointX,
                                    double pointY,
                                    boolean testLeftSide)
        Returns a boolean value, stating whether a 2D point is on the left or right side of this line. The idea of "side" is determined based on the direction of the line.

        For instance, given the this.direction components x = 0, and y = 1, and the this.point coordinates x = 0, and y = 0, a point located on:

        • the left side of this line has a negative y coordinate.
        • the right side of this line has a positive y coordinate.

        This method will return false if the point is on this line.
        Parameters:
        pointX - the x-coordinate of the query point.
        pointY - the y-coordinate of the query point.
        testLeftSide - the query of the side, when equal to true this will test for the left side, false this will test for the right side.
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the query side of this line, false if the point is on the opposite side or exactly on this line.

      • isPointOnSideOfLine

        default boolean isPointOnSideOfLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point,
                                    boolean testLeftSide)
        Returns a boolean value, stating whether a 2D point is on the left or right side of this line. The idea of "side" is determined based on the direction of the line.

        For instance, given the this.direction components x = 0, and y = 1, and the this.point coordinates x = 0, and y = 0, a point located on:

        • the left side of this line has a negative y coordinate.
        • the right side of this line has a positive y coordinate.

        This method will return false if the point is on this line.
        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query point.
        testLeftSide - the query of the side, when equal to true this will test for the left side, false this will test for the right side.
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the query side of this line, false if the point is on the opposite side or exactly on this line.

      • orthogonalProjection

        default boolean orthogonalProjection(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics pointToProject)
        Computes the orthogonal projection of the given 2D point on this 2D line.

        Edge cases:

        • if the given line direction is too small, i.e. lineDirection.lengthSquared() < , this method fails and returns false.

        Parameters:
        pointToProject - the point to project on this line. Modified.
        Returns:
        whether the method succeeded or not.

      • orthogonalProjection

        default boolean orthogonalProjection(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointToProject,
                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics projectionToPack)
        Computes the orthogonal projection of the given 2D point on this 2D line.

        Edge cases:

        • if the given line direction is too small, i.e. lineDirection.lengthSquared() < , this method fails and returns false.

        Parameters:
        pointToProject - the point to compute the projection of. Not modified.
        projectionToPack - point in which the projection of the point onto the line is stored. Modified.
        Returns:
        whether the method succeeded or not.

      • orthogonalProjectionCopy

        default us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics orthogonalProjectionCopy(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointToProject)
        Computes the orthogonal projection of the given 2D point on this 2D line.

        Edge cases:

        • if the given line direction is too small, i.e. lineDirection.lengthSquared() < , this method fails and returns false.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Parameters:
        pointToProject - the point to compute the projection of. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the projection of the point onto the line or null if the method failed.

      • parameterGivenPointOnLine

        default double parameterGivenPointOnLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointOnLine,
                                         double epsilon)
        Calculates the parameter 't' corresponding to the coordinates of the given pointOnLine 'p' by solving the line equation:
        p = t * n + p0
        where n is the unit-vector defining the direction of this line and p0 is the point defining this line which also corresponds to the point for which t=0.

        Note that the absolute value of 't' is equal to the distance between the point 'p' and the point p0 defining this line.

        Parameters:
        pointOnLine - the coordinates of the 'p' from which the parameter 't' is to be calculated. The point has to be on the line. Not modified.
        epsilon - the maximum distance allowed between the given point and this line. If the given point is at a distance less than epsilon from this line, it is considered as being located on this line.
        Returns:
        the value of the parameter 't' corresponding to the given point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the given point is located at a distance greater than epsilon from this line.

      • perpendicularLineThroughPoint

        default Line2DBasics perpendicularLineThroughPoint(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point)
        Calculates and returns a line that is perpendicular to this line, with its direction pointing to the left of this line, while going through the given point.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Parameters:
        point - the point the line has to go through. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the line perpendicular to this and going through point.

      • perpendicularLineThroughPoint

        default void perpendicularLineThroughPoint(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point,
                                           Line2DBasics perpendicularLineToPack)
        Modifies perpendicularLineToPack such that it is perpendicular to this line, with its direction pointing to the left of this line, while going through the given point.
        Parameters:
        point - the point the line has to go through. Not modified.
        perpendicularLineToPack - the line perpendicular to this and going through point. Modified.

      • perpendicularVector

        default us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DBasics perpendicularVector()
        Returns the vector that is perpendicular to this line and pointing to the left.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Returns:
        the perpendicular vector to this line.

      • perpendicularVector

        default void perpendicularVector(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DBasics vectorToPack)
        Packs into vectorToPack the vector that is perpendicular to this line and pointing to the left.
        Parameters:
        vectorToPack - the perpendicular vector to this line. Modified.

      • pointOnLineGivenParameter

        default us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics pointOnLineGivenParameter(double t)
        Calculates the coordinates of the point 'p' given the parameter 't' as follows:
        p = t * n + p0
        where n is the unit-vector defining the direction of this line and p0 is the point defining this line which also corresponds to the point for which t=0.

        Note that the absolute value of 't' is equal to the distance between the point 'p' and the point p0 defining this line.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Parameters:
        t - the parameter used to calculate the point coordinates.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the point 'p'.

      • pointOnLineGivenParameter

        default void pointOnLineGivenParameter(double t,
                                       us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics pointToPack)
        Calculates the coordinates of the point 'p' given the parameter 't' as follows:
        p = t * n + p0
        where n is the unit-vector defining the direction of this line and p0 is the point defining this line which also corresponds to the point for which t=0.

        Note that the absolute value of 't' is equal to the distance between the point 'p' and the point p0 defining this line.

        Parameters:
        t - the parameter used to calculate the point coordinates.
        pointToPack - the point in which the coordinates of 'p' are stored. Modified.

      • getTwoPointsOnLine

        default void getTwoPointsOnLine(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstPointOnLineToPack,
                                us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics secondPointOnLineToPack)
        Gets the coordinates of two distinct points this line goes through.
        Parameters:
        firstPointOnLineToPack - the coordinates of a first point located on this line. Modified.
        secondPointOnLineToPack - the coordinates of a second point located on this line. Modified.

      • interiorBisector

        default Line2DBasics interiorBisector(Line2DReadOnly secondLine)
        Calculates the interior bisector defined by this line and the given secondLine.

        The interior bisector is defined as follows:

        • It goes through the intersection between this line and secondLine.
        • Its direction point toward this line direction and the secondLine's direction such that: interiorBisector.direction.dot(this.direction) > 0.0 and interiorBisector.direction.dot(secondLine.direction) > 0.0.
        • Finally the angle from this to the interior bisector is half the angle from this to secondLine.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two lines are parallel but not collinear, this method fails, returns null.
        • If the two lines are collinear, this method returns a copy of this.

        Parameters:
        secondLine - the second line needed to calculate the interior bisector. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the interior bisector if this method succeeded, null otherwise.

      • interiorBisector

        default boolean interiorBisector(Line2DReadOnly secondLine,
                                 Line2DBasics interiorBisectorToPack)
        Calculates the interior bisector defined by this line and the given secondLine.

        The interior bisector is defined as follows:

        • It goes through the intersection between this line and secondLine.
        • Its direction point toward this line direction and the secondLine's direction such that: interiorBisector.direction.dot(this.direction) > 0.0 and interiorBisector.direction.dot(secondLine.direction) > 0.0.
        • Finally the angle from this to the interior bisector is half the angle from this to secondLine.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two lines are parallel but not collinear, this method fails, returns false, and interiorBisectorToPack remains unchanged.
        • If the two lines are collinear, interiorBisectorToPack is set to this.

        Parameters:
        secondLine - the second line needed to calculate the interior bisector. Not modified.
        interiorBisectorToPack - the line in which the interior bisector point and direction are stored. Modified.
        Returns:
        true if this method succeeded, false otherwise.

      • xIntercept

        default double xIntercept()
        The x-coordinate at which this line intercept the x-axis, i.e. the line defined by y=0.
        Returns:
        the x-coordinate of the intersection between this line and the x-axis.

      • yIntercept

        default double yIntercept()
        The y-coordinate at which this line intercept the y-axis, i.e. the line defined by x=0.
        Returns:
        the y-coordinate of the intersection between this line and the y-axis.

      • slope

        default double slope()
        Calculates the slope value of this line.

        The slope 's' can be used to calculate the y-coordinate of a point located on the line given its x-coordinate:
        y = s * x + y0
        where y0 is the y-coordinate at which this line intercepts the y-axis and which can be obtained with yIntercept().

        Returns:
        the value of the slope of this line.

      • isCollinear

        default boolean isCollinear(Line2DReadOnly other,
                            double epsilon)
        Compares this with other to determine if the two lines are collinear.
        Parameters:
        other - the line to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the lines are collinear, false otherwise.

      • isCollinear

        default boolean isCollinear(Line2DReadOnly other,
                            double angleEpsilon,
                            double distanceEpsilon)
        Compares this with other to determine if the two lines are collinear.
        Parameters:
        other - the line to compare to. Not modified.
        angleEpsilon - the tolerance of the comparison for angle.
        distanceEpsilon - the tolerance of the comparison for distance.
        Returns:

      • areLinesPerpendicular

        default boolean areLinesPerpendicular(Line2DReadOnly other)
        Tests if this line and the other line are perpendicular.
        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines are perpendicular, false otherwise.

      • epsilonEquals

        default boolean epsilonEquals(Line2DReadOnly other,
                              double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on the point and vector if this line is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon. This method will return false if the two lines are physically the same but either the point or vector of each line is different. For instance, if this.point == other.point and this.direction == - other.direction, the two lines are physically the same but this method returns false.
        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines are equal, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        default boolean geometricallyEquals(Line2DReadOnly other,
                                    double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two lines are geometrically similar.

        Two lines are considered geometrically equal is they are collinear, pointing toward the same or opposite direction.

        Parameters:
        other - the line to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if this and other are not expressed in the same reference frame.

      • equals

        default boolean equals(Line2DReadOnly other)
        Tests on a per component basis, if this line 2D is exactly equal to other.
        Parameters:
        other - the other line 2D to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines are exactly equal component-wise, false otherwise.
